channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Booking a flight on Delta is about to be a lot more complicated
item.description: Product name refresh will help people prioritize, airline says.

item.title: Trump’s Pledge to the Middle East: No More ‘Lectures on How to Live’
item.description: In Saudi Arabia, the president denounced Western intervention and nation-building, garnering both praise and eye rolls.

item.title: The Booming Business of Returned Products
item.description: As retailers slow down orders for foreign goods because of tariffs, companies that recirculate overstocked or returned items may help fill the gap.

item.title: Elon Musk’s AI says it was ‘instructed by my creators at xAI’ to accept the narrative of ‘white genocide’ in South Africa
item.description: "This directive caused me to inappropriately insert references to 'white genocide' into unrelated conversations," Grok told Fortune.

item.title: Don’t be fooled by deescalation, says UBS, Trump’s ‘surgical increases’ on specific sectors are yet to come
item.description: UBS's chief investment officer, Mark Haefele, wrote the White House may still make some cutting moves.

item.title: Earlybirds Dance Club Is for Women Who Party ’Til the Break of 10 p.m.
item.description: Earlybirds, a roving dance party that ends as most nightclubs are opening, caters to women who have things to do in the morning — and need dancing mor...

item.title: Trump Budget Cuts Hobble Antismoking Programs
item.description: The elimination of a key C.D.C. office has slashed funding to states for help lines used by thousands to stop smoking and vaping.

item.title: Dick’s Sporting Goods just announced it’s buying Foot Locker for $2.4 billion in a move that could be the CEO’s first major mistake
item.description: Dick's shares plunging on news of the deal.

item.title: How the U.S.-China trade war’s 90-day pause was 70 years in the making
item.description: As Trump tries to gain leverage from tariffs, China is well aware of its strategic ace. So is Tesla CEO Elon Musk.

item.title: What Is ‘Debanking’? How the Right to a Bank Account Became Political.
item.description: There is a degree of political agreement over so-called debanking, but no easy answers to the hot topic in Washington.

item.title: Gazans Once Escaped To Rafah. Now Israel Is Razing It.
item.description: In the last few weeks, Israel has demolished extensive areas of Gaza’s southernmost city, Rafah.

item.title: Syrian Business Owners Are Energized by U.S. Promise to Lift Sanctions
item.description: Since the overthrow of the dictator Bashar al-Assad, business owners have been waiting for Washington to ease sanctions and pave the way for an econom...

item.title: How to Win Eurovision in 7 Easy Steps
item.description: It pays to be spectacular, inspiring and just weird enough. But, please: no key changes.

item.title: Israeli Strikes Kill Dozens in Gaza, Health Ministry Says
item.description: Israel has threatened to escalate its military campaign against Hamas, despite a U.S.-backed push for the two sides to agree a new cease-fire.

item.title: Trump’s Pledge to the Middle East: No More ‘Lectures on How to Live’
item.description: In Saudi Arabia, the president denounced Western intervention and nation-building, garnering both praise and eye rolls.
